results.title: Weight and circuit training
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Nicholas Cockram, Bruce Moir and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode no. 3 of Series “Conditioning for Sport”
Describes many specific exercises and training and condition techniques necessary for those interested in weight training. Weight training is a proven method for athletes to develop strength, power and muscular endurance, so it differs from weight lifting which emphasises strength and firm body building.

results.title: Running and mobility
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Nicholas Cockram, Bruce Moir, South Australian Film Corporation and Slater Sound Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conditioning for Sport”.
Gives an insight into the specific exercises, training and conditioning techniques necessary for proficiency in running. Describes how the body adjusts to new levels of achievement with the proper training. (Photographer, David Foreman ; Script, Terry Jennings ; Editor, Andrew Prowse ; Sound, Rod Pascoe).

results.title: Management in the community
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Confusion in the elderly”.
One of a series about the techniques for management and treatment of confusion in the elderly. Traces the case of an elderly woman whose family wants to have her committed to hospital or a home. However, with medical advice it is possible for her to remain at home.

results.title: Management in hospital
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Confusion in the elderly”.
One of a series about the techniques for management and treatment of confusion in the elderly. This demonstrates a variety of treatments of admission to hospital. Shows actual patients with different presentations of confusion, and outlines basic principles of management designed to allow the patients to get the most out of life.

results.title: Set design in Little J and Big Cuz
results.creator_credit: Tony Thorne and Ned Lander Media Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: Five-year-old Little J and nine-year-old Big Cuz are a couple of indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and old dog. All their friends are nearby, and school is just a stroll away along a bush track.

constellations_primary.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_primary.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Thorne and Ned Lander Media Pty Ltd
results.description:
There’s a world of adventure over Little J and Big Cuz’s back fence. Their house is magically located at the doorstep of the desert, bush and coast – environments that represent where the show’s writers are from. And as locations in the first animated show made for Indigenous Australian kids by an Indigenous crew, these environments aren’t just settings for great stories – they reflect the different landscapes of the people the show was made for. To the show’s fans, Little J and Big Cuz live in the same place they do.

They also speak like them. Each season, Indigenous communities could choose an episode to have translated into their traditional language. Naturally, they typically picked episodes set in locations that represent their country.
description_for_label:
There’s a world of adventure over Little J and Big Cuz’s back fence. Their house is magically located at the doorstep of the desert, bush and coast – environments that represent where the show’s writers are from. And as locations in the first animated show made for Indigenous Australian kids by an Indigenous crew, these environments aren’t just settings for great stories – they reflect the different landscapes of the people the show was made for. To the show’s fans, Little J and Big Cuz live in the same place they do.

They also speak like them. Each season, Indigenous communities could choose an episode to have translated into their traditional language. Naturally, they typically picked episodes set in locations that represent their country.

results.title: The Earthshrinker
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concorde”.
Illustrates the advantages of the Concorde for world travel. Shows a brief history of the plane and the new technology involved.
